issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Trying to run the example job from contrib/pig (after fixing it to start at all in the first place; details later) results in this:

fields.environment: Ubuntu 10.04 with Hadoop from Cloudera CDH3b2

author.name: tv42
author.emailAddress: tv+apache dot jira at eagain dot net

comments.body: A script with some auxiliary files to reproduce said problem from scratch. Assumes a working Hadoop installation, pseudo-distributed mode is fine.

updateAuthor.name: tv42
updateAuthor.emailAddress: tv+apache dot jira at eagain dot net

author.name: jeromatron
author.emailAddress: jeremy dot hanna1234 at gmail dot com

comments.body: It works if you manually build pig and put your storage-conf.xml in the jar, but there is something wrong with how it's trying to find the storage-conf.xml.  It shouldn't matter with 0.7 since it's only using hadoop vars or env vars (CASSANDRA-1322).  However, it needs to be addressed in 0.6.x so that it's more usable.

updateAuthor.name: jeromatron
updateAuthor.emailAddress: jeremy dot hanna1234 at gmail dot com

author.name: tv42
author.emailAddress: tv+apache dot jira at eagain dot net

comments.body: This seems to be the right fix; URIs/URLs are loaded from jars, just filenames are not.

updateAuthor.name: tv42
updateAuthor.emailAddress: tv+apache dot jira at eagain dot net
